DataElement.preferredName: Eligibility Criteria Stable Corticosteroid Regimen Prior to Start of Treatment Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Indicator of whether or not the patient be on a stable corticosteroid regimen prior to the start of treatment.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria Stable Therapeutic Corticosteroid Treatment Regimen Prior Begin Therapeutic Procedure
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria._Subject to little fluctuation; showing little if any change._Any steroid hormone made in the adrenal cortex (the outer part of the adrenal gland). They are also made in the laboratory. Corticosteroids have many different effects in the body, and are used to treat many different conditions. They may be used as hormone replacement, to suppress the immune system, and to treat some side effects of cancer and its treatment. Corticosteroids are also used to treat certain lymphomas and lymphoid leukemias._A treatment plan that specifies the dosage, the schedule, and the duration of treatment._Earlier in time or order._Have a beginning, in a temporal, spatial, or evaluative sense; the point in space or time where something begins._An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter or stop a pathologic process.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

Concepts.definition: Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

Property.preferredName: Stable Therapeutic Corticosteroid Treatment Regimen Prior Begin Therapeutic Procedure
Property.preferredDefinition: Subject to little fluctuation; showing little if any change.:Any steroid hormone made in the adrenal cortex (the outer part of the adrenal gland). They are also made in the laboratory. Corticosteroids have many different effects in the body, and are used to treat many different conditions. They may be used as hormone replacement, to suppress the immune system, and to treat some side effects of cancer and its treatment. Corticosteroids are also used to treat certain lymphomas and lymphoid leukemias.:A treatment plan that specifies the dosage, the schedule, and the duration of treatment.:Earlier in time or order.:Have a beginning, in a temporal, spatial, or evaluative sense; the point in space or time where something begins.:An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter or stop a pathologic process.

Concepts.definition: Subject to little fluctuation; showing little if any change.

Any steroid hormone made in the adrenal cortex (the outer part of the adrenal gland). They are also made in the laboratory. Corticosteroids have many different effects in the body, and are used to treat many different conditions. They may be used as hormone replacement, to suppress the immune system, and to treat some side effects of cancer and its treatment. Corticosteroids are also used to treat certain lymphomas and lymphoid leukemias.
A treatment plan that specifies the dosage, the schedule, and the duration of treatment.
Have a beginning, in a temporal, spatial, or evaluative sense; the point in space or time where something begins.
An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter or stop a pathologic process.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.

ReferenceDocuments.name: Will the patient be on a stab

ReferenceDocuments.description: Will the patient be on a stable corticosteroid regimen for 5 days prior to the start of treatment?
